adjective.definition: Lacking the power to perform physically demanding tasks; lacking physical strength and energy.
adjective.example: She was recovering from the flu and felt very weak.

adjective.definition: Liable to break or give way under pressure; easily damaged.
adjective.example: The bridge is too weak to carry heavy traffic.

noun.definition: The state or condition of lacking strength; weakness.
A person or thing that one is unable to resist or likes excessively.
noun.example: He has a weakness for chocolate.
